requirements: Assistance to the 7 defenses (apart from his own).
Release into repository with all the requested information.
Correct use of issues in the repository.
Correct use of branches, with a clear workflow (develop branch with small branches for each feature).
All products deployed in cloud services (PaaS or SaaS).
All files and source code defined in the deliverables section.
All products are functional and connected to each other.
Inside the README of the repository: Test users, Installation guide, User manual, Links of interest (e.g. API documentation)

clarifications: Clarity in project communication
Organization and structure of the presentation
Ability to convey technical concepts understandably to the audience
Ability to highlight system benefits and features
Skill in persuading and convincing the audience of the project's value
Effective use of examples and demonstrations to showcase the system in action
Formal or semi-formal attire (dress to impress)
Correct use of the stage
Implemented features meet the requirements outlined in the definition
Consideration of the quality and performance of implemented features
Proper handling of errors and exceptions
Effective collaboration and equitable distribution of tasks among team members
Appropriate use of version control tools like Git and GitHub
Clear and understandable commit history in the GitHub repository
Correct use of Issues for project task management
Use of a workflow where the main branch is protected, there is a development branch, and features are implemented in short-lived branches
Merges occur through a Pull Request, with approval from at least 2 team members
Creation of a release on GitHub containing important information about the system
Correct configuration and deployment of the system on a cloud platform
Consideration of aspects such as security, scalability, and availability in the deployment environment
Demonstration of access and operation of the system in the cloud environment
Evaluation of the user interface in terms of aesthetics, usability, and user experience
Consideration of best design practices and good design decisions
Consistency in the appearance and experience of the system across all screens and flows
